k9shieldBanner.title: K9Shield: Comprehensive Security Middleware
k9shieldBanner.description: Advanced security middleware for Node.js applications, providing robust protection against DDoS attacks, rate limiting, IP management, and comprehensive security features

k9shieldFaq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
k9shieldFaq.subtitle: Detailed information about K9Shield's features and implementation.

coreFeatures.question: What are the core security features of K9Shield?
coreFeatures.answer: K9Shield offers comprehensive security features including DDoS protection with a progressive penalty system, rate limiting with route-specific limits, IP management with CIDR notation support, request validation, security headers management, pattern detection, and comprehensive monitoring and logging capabilities.

ddosProtection.question: How does DDoS protection work?
ddosProtection.answer: K9Shield's DDoS protection includes a progressive penalty system, connection tracking, surge detection, path-based rate limiting, and configurable thresholds. It monitors connection rates, automatically blocks suspicious IPs, and offers flexible configuration options for maximum connections and blocking durations.

rateLimiting.question: What kind of rate limiting options are available?
rateLimiting.answer: K9Shield offers route-specific limits, flexible time windows, throttling support, ban duration management, and distributed system support. You can configure different limits with customizable thresholds for various endpoints and HTTP methods.

ipManagement.question: How does the IP management system work?
ipManagement.answer: The IP management system supports CIDR notation, IPv6 with IPv4 mapping, private IP detection, whitelist/blacklist functionality, and proxy support. You can easily manage and monitor IP addresses through the provided API.

securityHeaders.question: Which security headers are supported?
securityHeaders.answer: K9Shield supports Content Security Policy (CSP), Permissions Policy, HSTS, XSS protection, frame options, and content type options. These headers are configurable to improve your application's security posture.

patternDetection.question: How does the pattern detection system work?
patternDetection.answer: The pattern detection system identifies SQL injection patterns, XSS patterns, path traversal attempts, and supports custom patterns. You can add your own detection patterns and configure response actions.

monitoring.question: What monitoring and logging features are available?
monitoring.answer: K9Shield provides multiple log levels, automatic rotation, archive management, performance metrics, and security event tracking. The logging system includes IP tracking, request duration monitoring, path tracking, and detailed request information.

configuration.question: How do I configure K9Shield for my application?
configuration.answer: K9Shield is configurable through a comprehensive configuration object that includes settings for security, rate limiting, DDoS protection, logging, and error handling. You can customize these settings to fit your application's needs.

installation.question: How do I install k9cli?
installation.answer: You can install k9cli globally using npm: npm install -g k9cli. Make sure you have Node.js installed on your system.

requirements.question: What are the system requirements?
requirements.answer: k9cli requires Node.js version 14 or higher. It works on Windows, macOS, and Linux operating systems.

commands.question: What are the main available commands?
commands.answer: k9cli provides commands for room management (create, join, list) and message operations (send, view). Use k9cli --help to see all available commands.

encryption.question: How secure is the encryption?
encryption.answer: k9cli uses industry-standard end-to-end encryption protocols to ensure your messages and rooms are secure.

updates.question: How do I update k9cli?
updates.answer: You can update k9cli to the latest version by running: npm update -g k9cli
